oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oath of Allegiance for Mrs. Hannah M. Morey
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Document representing the oath of allegiance certificate issued to Mrs. Hannah M. Morey of Williamson County by the Provost Marshal's Office in Nashville, Tennessee, on June 15, 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Union Provost Marshal's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: As a legal document, an oath represents a sworn declaration taking place in front of an authorized individual. In this case, the loyalty oath represents sworn allegiance to the Union by a civilian at a Union Provost Marshal's Office. Such oaths were initially used for military and Federal government employment purposes but were broadened in scope to tackle the far-reaching issues of loyalty during this turbulent period in the nation's history.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civil War in the West; Civil War society; United States - History - 1783-1865; United States - History - 1849-1877; United States History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Williamson County (Tenn.)
Civil Wars; War
